sentences.english: The George Takei crossover was a priceless one.
sentences.chinese: 竹井乔治的穿越表演就是一个无价的例子。

sentences.english: The speed of a runaway horse counts for nothing.
sentences.chinese: 脱缰之马的速度毫无价值。

sentences.english: The exemption, Dr Denholm reckons, is "totally worthless".
sentences.chinese: 德诺姆博士认为这种豁免“毫无价值”。

sentences.english: Our children, of course, are priceless.
sentences.chinese: 我们的孩子当然是无价之宝。

sentences.english: BINLEY philosophy is indeed priceless, quality sharing.
sentences.chinese: BINLEY的理念是真情无价，品质共享。

sentences.english: For thus saith the LORD, Ye have sold yourselves for nought; and ye shall be redeemed without money.
sentences.chinese: 耶和华如此说，你们是无价被卖的，也必无银被赎。

sentences.english: Each one of us, on our own, is worthless.
sentences.chinese: 我们每一个人，就自身来说，毫无价值。

sentences.english: Mere cleverness without sound principles does not count for anything.
sentences.chinese: 光是聪明而无正确的原则是毫无价值的。

sentences.english: Little boy as I was before, Mon and Dad considered me as their most valuable treasure.
sentences.chinese: 以前，是少不更事的小男孩，父母心中的无价之宝。

sentences.english: Virtue is a jewel of great price.
sentences.chinese: 美好的品德乃是无价宝。

sentences.english: Talk is cheep. But it can save priceless lives.
sentences.chinese: 讲解是廉价的，但可以拯救无价的生命。

sentences.english: you ask, knowing no payment could ever suffice.
sentences.chinese: 你问道，虽然你知道救命之恩无价可报。

sentences.english: One nightingale sang at her heart's content: happiness is priceless.
sentences.chinese: 夜莺尽情歌唱着幸福无价。

sentences.english: Truly priceless treasures are made of love and cannot be purchased with money.
sentences.chinese: 真正的无价宝是出自真心，而非用钱能买到。

sentences.english: Your time is priceless. Are you treating it that way?
sentences.chinese: 你是时间是无价之宝，你是这样看待它么？

sentences.english: Such attitudes are valueless unless they reflect inner cognition and certainty .
sentences.chinese: 这种态度如果不能反映内心的认知和把握就毫无价值。

definition: can't be bought for one thousand in gold (idiom)
to place great importance on/to treasure
valuable/precious/to value/to treasure/to set store by
can be discovered but not sought (idiom)/one can only come across such things serendipitously
to give a present/to accord (a favor)/to grant
